metadata.title: CVE-2020-2627 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Parser). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.18 and prior.Easily exploitable vulnerability allows low privileged attacker withnetwork access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized abilityto cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQLServer. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 6.5 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-2627` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-client - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-router - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-server - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.19-0ubuntu2').
